item.title: Organization vs Procastination
item.description: During undergrad school I leaned heavily on Anki. It did a really good job on keeping me up with a few hard to grasp concepts and formulas, while muscling up my memory with many banal stuff in a few harder courses. It was fun, easy and readily actionable, you can get instant feedback on how you’re going. Even though I loved it, I haven’t touched it properly in years. I’ve tried, but memorizing formulas doesn’t seem that valuable anymore.
